intro: Hedysarum incanum, commonly known as the silver vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming in early summer. Its trifoliate leaves are compound, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Hedysarum incanum is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
